description: Erection of a single storey first floor infill extension with roof extension above. Installation of three rear dormer windows and two front rooflights. Revised rear fenestration and restoration of existing rear chimney.

constraints_details.constraints_layer_description: CONARA CA49 : Rush Common Brixton Hill Conservation Area

decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be begun no later than three years from the date of this decision notice.Reason: To comply with the provision of Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990.

The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in complete accordance with the approved plans and drawings listed in this decision notice, other than where those details are altered pursuant to conditions of this planning permission. Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

All new external work and finishes and work of making good shall match the original work in respect of the materials, colour, texture, profile and finished appearance, except where indicated otherwise on the drawings hereby approved or unless otherwise required by condition. Reason: To preserve the character and appearance of the Rush Common and Brixton Hill Conservation Area. (Policies Q5, Q8, Q11 and Q22 of the Lambeth Local Plan (2021)).

Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, details of the existing and proposed windows, including sections at a scale of 1:5 and 1:20, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the approved details.Reason:  Development must not commence before this condition is discharged to ensure that the design of the proposed windows would accurately replicate the existing fenestration, thereby protecting the special interest of the Rush Common and Brixton Hill Conservation Area, in compliance with Policy Q22 of Lambeth's Local Plan (2021).

Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, details of the proposed doors, including sections at a scale of 1:5 and 1:20, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the approved details.Reason:  Development must not commence before this condition is discharged to ensure that the design of the proposed doors are suitable, thereby protecting the special interest of the Rush Common and Brixton Hill Conservation Area, in compliance with Policy Q22 of Lambeth's Local Plan (2021).

Prior to commencement of the development hereby approved, a sample panel of the proposed brickwork, shall be submitted to (in the form of photographs in context on site) and approved in writing by the local planning authority. All new brickwork shall match the existing brick in terms of size, colour, texture, bond and pointing.The development shall not be carried out other than in accordance with the approved details.Reason:  Development must not commence before this condition is discharged to ensure that the bricks would match the existing in terms of size, colour, texture, bond and pointing, thereby protecting the special interest of the Rush Common and Brixton Hill Conservation Area, in compliance with Policy Q22 of Lambeth's Local Plan (2021).

Notwithstanding the approved plans, prior to the occupation of the development hereby permitted, the dormer window(s) located at second floor level shown on plans 23036_P1_12 Rev C, 2306_P1_20 Rev C, 23036_P1_31 Rev C, shall be fitted with obscure glass or obscure glazing film over the entirety of the glass, to a minimum level of obscurity equivalent to Pilkington Texture Glass Level 3, and shall be retained as such for the duration of the development.Reason:  To protect the amenities of adjoining occupiers in compliance with Policy Q2 of Lambeth's Local Plan (2021).

Notwithstanding the approved plans, the proposed front rooflights are to be conservation style, flush with the roofslope with a central, vertical glazing bar.Reason:  To preserve the character and appearance of the Rush Common and Brixton Hill Conservation Area. (Policies Q5, Q8, Q11 and Q22 of the Lambeth Local Plan (2021)).
